intro: Melampyrum ciliare, commonly known as the fringed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Melampyrum ciliare is also known for its ability to form symbiotic relationships with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, contributing to soil fertility.
